author: Albert Einstein

quote: And why not death rather than living torment? To die is to be banish'd from myself; And Silvia is myself: banish'd from her Is self from self: a deadly banishment!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I had seen birth and death but had thought they were different.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Death never takes the wise man by surprise, he is always ready to go.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.
author: Alice Walker

quote: In our Western culture, although death has come out of the closet, it is still not openly experienced or discussed. Allowing dying to be so intensely present enriches both the preciousness of each moment and our detachment from it.
author: Ram Dass

quote: Death is the veil which those who live call life; They sleep, and it is lifted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: People have their own deaths as well as their own lives, and even if there is nothing beyond death, we shall differ in our nothingness.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Belief is the death of intelligence.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: If you don't know how to die, don't worry; Nature will tell you what to do on the spot, fully and adequately. She will do this job perfectly for you; don't bother your head about it.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: It is not death, it is dying that alarms me.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: When death comes it is never our tenderness that we repent from, but our severity.
author: George Eliot

quote: Death is the king of this world: 'Tis his park where he breeds life to feed him. Cries of pain are music for his banquet.
author: George Eliot

quote: Life is trouble. Only death is not. To be alive is to unfasten your belt and look for a fight.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: It is impossible that anything so natural, so necessary, and so universal as death, should ever have been designed by providence as an evil to mankind.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: I'm not proud of killing, of being responsible for the death of a single person. I never will be.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: I never really got on that well with Yoko anyway. Strangely enough, I only started to get to know her after John's death.
author: Paul McCartney

quote: If nothing else, there's comfort in recognising that no matter how much we fail and sin, death will limit our suffering.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: It is possible to provide security against other ills, but as far as death is concerned, we men live in a city without walls.
author: Epicurus

quote: In the night of death, hope sees a star, and listening love can hear the rustle of a wing.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatsoever to do with it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: If you look in general at people who live in anarchy, they have quite high rates of death from either homicide or warfare or both. Anarchy is one of the main reasons for violence, and it may be the most important.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: It is true that raids and battles killed a tiny percentage of the numbers that die in modern warfare. But in tribal violence, the clashes are more frequent, the percentage of men in the population who fight is greater, and the rates of death per battle are higher.
author: Steven Pinker

quote: We must assimilate the thought that life between death and a new birth is so constituted that everything we do awakens an echo in the environment.
author: Rudolf Steiner

quote: Since the day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: We have abolished the death penalty for humans, so why should it continue for animals?
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Generosity during life is a very different thing from generosity in the hour of death; one proceeds from genuine liberality and benevolence, the other from pride or fear.
author: Horace Mann

quote: From my perspective, there's no reason to be afraid of aging, because if you age, you're lucky! The alternative is death.
author: Drew Barrymore

quote: I'm not personally obsessed with death. At a certain age, the light that you live in is inhabited by the shades - it 'tis.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: If Shaw and Einstein couldn't beat death, what chance have I got? Practically none.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: Take care of your life and the Lord will take care of your death.
author: George Whitefield

quote: Death is an endless night so awful to contemplate that it can make us love life and value it with such passion that it may be the ultimate cause of all joy and all art.
author: Paul Theroux

quote: The sinner who suddenly realizes God's love for him and then looks at his rejection of that love feels a loss similar to the death of a loved one. A deep void is created in the soul and a loneliness akin to the agony of death.
author: Mother Angelica

quote: We do not choose the day of our birth nor may we choose the day of our death, yet choice is the sovereign faculty of the mind.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: It's a consoling notion that death is a very tiny hole, and you need to make yourself very small to get through it. One obviously needs to lighten off, and a rucksack full of bricks or a mantelpiece full of trophies will certainly have to be abandoned - the sooner the better, I say.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Death threatens our speech with futility because death is not just a biological event - it is a reality we fear may rob our living of any significance.
author: Stanley Hauerwas

quote: I have a moral position against the death penalty. But I took an oath of office to uphold it. Following an oath of office is also a moral obligation.
author: Tim Kaine

quote: Form is, in a way, death. A novelist's obligation is to break free from the form, even though he knows that this will also be seen as artificial and distanced from life.
author: Karl Ove Knausgaard

quote: When I first met Alan Parker, who directed 'Angel Heart,' he'd heard so many horror stories about me that he was literally scared to death of me. Right away, he sat me down and said, 'I'm very scared of you. I've heard you're a very bad boy.'
author: Mickey Rourke

quote: In your teens and twenties, death doesn't exist. In your thirties, you glance down the road occasionally. But then in your forties, it becomes a full-time job looking the other way.
author: John Niven

quote: I do not mourn the death of the printed letter in a snobby, East Coast, patrician way - 'Where have our manners gone?' - but because I love objects, I love paper, and I love something that I can hold to my chest for a moment. Still, I bear no grudge against the e-mail form itself.
author: Jami Attenberg

quote: Israel should not feel satisfaction at my son's death, for he died on the battlefield, facing the conquerors as he wished, with a gun in his hand.
author: Hassan Nasrallah

quote: As far as thinking about death and murder and various ways of killing people and how people die... I probably have the most twisted mind in Slayer.
author: Tom Araya

quote: The thing is, I love a great death scene - no good actor doesn't. Sorry, any actor, I should say.
author: Clark Gregg

quote: Only in death will I relinquish my belts.
author: Manny Pacquiao

quote: Hell, madam, is to love no longer.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: I'm a Ninja. I'm not scared of death.
author: Watkin Tudor Jones

quote: For example, colon cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in the United States. Every four minutes someone is diagnosed, and every nine minutes someone dies.
author: Kevin Richardson

quote: Hope, insofar as it is hope of resurrection, is the living contradiction of what it proceeds from and what is placed under the sign of the Cross and death.
author: Paul Ricoeur

quote: The gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.
author: Lucan

quote: Time for me is double-edged: every day brings me further from the low of my last cancer relapse, but every day also brings me closer to the next cancer recurrence - and eventually, death. Perhaps later than I think, but certainly sooner than I desire.
author: Paul Kalanithi

quote: Marriage, like death, is a debt we owe to nature.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: Whoever has the luck to be born a character can laugh even at death. Because a character will never die! A man will die, a writer, the instrument of creation: but what he has created will never die!
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: We cannot banish dangers, but we can banish fears. We must not demean life by standing in awe of death.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: A detective sees death in all the various forms at least five times a week.
author: Evan Hunter

quote: Age makes all things greater after their death; a name comes to the tongue easier from the grave.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: I didn't get to go to prom; I was filming a death scene on my prom night. But I got to go to all the homecomings, and even the winter formals I got to go to, but the only thing I missed was the prom, but everything else was great.
author: Michael Angarano

quote: If any reader has lost a loved one or is afraid of death, modern physics says: 'Be comforted, you and they shall live again.'
author: Frank Tipler

quote: There are three things we have no control over: our birth; our emotions, if we're sincere; and our death.
author: Betty Parsons

quote: The times in my life when I've been my thinnest, I've been a walking psycho wreck. Forget the fact that I was basically starving myself; skinny was usually due to some kind of loss. Death. Rejection. Divorce.
author: Stephanie Klein

quote: This death cult has no reason and is beyond negotiation. This is what makes it so frightening. This is what causes so many to engage in a sort of mental diversion. They don't want to confront this horror. So they rush off in search of more comprehensible things to hate.
author: David Brooks

quote: Nothing is more dreadful in life than the profound thought that death may only greet you with eternal nothingness.
author: Kim Elizabeth

quote: Even at our birth, death does but stand aside a little. And every day he looks towards us and muses somewhat to himself whether that day or the next he will draw nigh.
author: Robert Bolt

quote: We all had lots of stories of our sad experiences - they mourned the death of my wife with me - but we were hopeful that the children would return.
author: Otto Frank

quote: Death does determine life.
author: Pier Paolo Pasolini

quote: I'm not afraid to die.
author: John Wooden

quote: 'Tis very certain the desire of life prolongs it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Die, v.: To stop sinning suddenly.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: To have died once is enough.
author: Virgil

quote: We die only once, and for such a long time.
author: Moliere

quote: The words of a dead man are modified in the guts of the living.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: A friend who dies, it's something of you who dies.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Death is a delightful hiding place for weary men.
author: Herodotus

quote: Birth and death; we all move between these two unknowns.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: To himself everyone is immortal; he may know that he is going to die, but he can never know that he is dead.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Some men are alive simply because it is against the law to kill them.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: The whole essence of the Christian religion is based on the atonement of Christ, his death and his resurrection.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived.
author: Willa Cather

quote: My character and good name are in my own keeping. Life with disgrace is dreadful. A glorious death is to be envied.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: Dying is easy, it's living that scares me to death.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Facing my own death brought an instant sense of clarity and purpose.
author: Tom Shadyac

quote: He who is completely sanctified, or cleansed from all sin, and dies in this state, is fit for glory.
author: Adam Clarke

quote: I tell myself that God gave my children many gifts - spirit, beauty, intelligence, the capacity to make friends and to inspire respect. There was only one gift he held back - length of life.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: For the sake of goodness and love, man shall let death have no sovereignty over his thoughts.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: All our knowledge merely helps us to die a more painful death than animals that know nothing.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: I think the idea that death is not the end, that your dog's just gone to live on the farm, is limiting. Thoughts like that prevent you from making the most of the time that you have.
author: Jimmy Carr

quote: All architects want to live beyond their deaths.
author: Philip Johnson

quote: The death of any man aged 56 is very sad for his widow and family. And no one would deny that Steve Jobs was a brilliant and highly innovative technician, with great business flair and marketing ability.
author: A. N. Wilson

quote: When a president makes life and death decisions, he should draw strength and wisdom from broad and deep experience with the reasons for and the risks of committing our children to our defense. For no matter how many others are involved in the decision, the president is a lonely man in a dark room when the casualty reports come in.
author: John McCain

quote: It's true you never know the full depth of a parent's touch in your life until they're gone. Even if you cared for them in their old age, there's never a way to prepare yourself for the death of a parent.
author: Donna Brazile

quote: Are there moments when I see unrequited crushes or ex-boyfriends slow dancing with their dates and kind of want to stab myself in the spleen with a salad fork? Yeah, sure.
author: Sloane Crosley

quote: Who is there that can adequately gauge the greatness of the humility, gentleness, self-surrender, revealed by the Lord of majesty in assuming human nature, in accepting the punishment of death, the shame of the cross?
author: Saint Bernard

quote: John Candy knew he was going to die. He told me on his 40th birthday. He said, well, Maureen, I'm on borrowed time.
author: Maureen O'Hara

quote: Call no man happy before he dies, he is at best but fortunate.
author: Solon

quote: Man dies of cold, not of darkness.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: Any man who has $10,000 left when he dies is a failure.
author: Errol Flynn

quote: You hear the word 'cancer,' it scares you. You think of death.
author: Joe Torre

quote: The typical Western diet is the number-one cause of premature death and the number-one cause of disability. In other words, a long and healthy life is largely a matter of choice.
author: Michael Greger

quote: Death is not more certainly a separation of our souls from our bodies than the Christian life is a separation of our souls from worldly tempers, vain indulgences, and unnecessary cares.
author: William Law

quote: I always think that in some way, art is the best tool we have to prepare for death. It's like a sculpture that you can interpret differently every time you look at it.
author: John Cameron Mitchell

quote: Someone who is about to die does not mourn the dead.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: I do believe that any sort of electromagnetic energy that can be measured beyond the moment of death is, by the definition of energy, eternal. But I cop to the fact that calling it a 'soul' and presuming it sustains our consciousness in any form is, to put it kindly, a leap.
author: Mark Waid

quote: Tradition demands that we not speak poorly of the dead.
author: Daniel Barenboim

quote: We shall not fight for the preservation of the enemy, which has laid waste with death and desolation the fields and hills of Ireland for 700 years.
author: James Larkin

quote: For me, habit is just a synonym for death.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: Why do we take pleasure in gruesome death, neatly packaged as a puzzle to which we may find a satisfactory solution through clues - or if we are not clever enough, have it revealed by the all-powerful tale-teller at the end of the book? It is something to do with being reduced to, and comforted by, playing by the rules.
author: A. S. Byatt

quote: If you don't have any fight in you, you might as well be dead.
author: Scott Caan

quote: If we can't face death, we'll never overcome it. You have to look it straight in the eye. Then you can turn around and walk back out into the light.
author: Maya Lin

quote: The death of what's dead is the birth of what's living.
author: Arlo Guthrie

quote: If consciousness can function independently of the body during one's lifetime, it could be able to do the same after death.
author: Stanislav Grof

quote: I am very emotional. It took me many years to recover from the death of my father. Even when I was playing cricket, I wasn't happy. I would just sit and cry. I was very young. He was too young; he shouldn't have gone. Cricket is all right. We all play sport. Good and bad days come.
author: Harbhajan Singh

quote: Death is always around the corner, but often our society gives it inordinate help.
author: Carter Burwell

quote: They can rule the world while they can persuade us our pain belongs in some order is death by famine worse than death by suicide, than a life of famine and suicide?
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Death is the cure for all diseases.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: We ourselves can die with comfort and even with joy if we know that death is but a passport to blessedness, that this intellect, freed from all material chains, shall rise and shine.
author: Matthew Simpson

quote: I detest life-insurance agents: they always argue that I shall some day die, which is not so.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Lebanon, Israel, Ireland, South Africa - wherever there is a bleeding sore on the body of the world, the same hard-eyed narrow-minded fanatics are busy, indifferent to life, in love with death.
author: J. M. Coetzee

quote: None of us, in our culture of comfort, know how to prepare ourselves for dying, but that's what we should do every day. Every single day, we die a thousand deaths.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

quote: Death can really absorb a person. Lik most people, I would find it pleasant not to have to go, but you just accept that it's more or less inevitable.
author: Graham Chapman

quote: Judged by the law of England, I know this crime entails upon me the penalty of death; but the history of Ireland explains that crime and justifies it.
author: Thomas Francis Meagher

quote: Death borders upon our birth, and our cradle stands in the grave.
author: Joseph Hall

quote: Death is the tyrant of the imagination.
author: Bryan Procter

quote: Fling but a stone, the giant dies.
author: Matthew Green

quote: A pig resembles a saint in that he is more honored after death than during his lifetime.
author: Irma S. Rombauer

quote: I'm an optimist, so I believe in some sort of life after death; I don't know what kind.
author: Mike Dirnt

quote: Nothing that is really good and God-like dies.
author: Ernst Moritz Arndt

quote: Death is the last enemy: once we've got past that I think everything will be alright.
author: Alice Thomas Ellis
